intro: Echium velutinum subsp. velutinum, commonly known as the velvet fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers in late summer, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry grasslands and rocky habitats. Its scientific name reflects its velvety foliage, which is a distinguishing characteristic of the species.
